lines.content: //each worker is attached to a calendar table to work on and an IO_handler to handle IO
//this design would allow the program to handle multi-user with multi-input-source case (with multi-thread)
//the IO_handler can be binded to a specific InputStream and a specific PrintStream (default to be stdin & stdout)
event_dispatcher worker_1=new event_dispatcher(new calendar(), new IO_handler());
* This class handles all IO related tasks
* having these encapsulated functions would make the core could a lot cleaner
* Currently this logo is hard-coded, but I'm thinking of reading it from a config file in later versions
return "Currently the following commands are supported:\n"+
result=result+"Hello, this is Olivia, your personal assistant\n";
result=result+"Hallo, ich bin Olivia, Ihre pers√∂nliche Assistentin\n";
result=result+"    For help message on how to communicate with me, type help\n";
* Just a simple encapsulation for the classic System.out.print function
* seems a little bit redundant, but helps me type less LOL
* function name comes from C++ std::cout
cout(generate_section("Sorry, I don't seem to understand you.\nMaybe there is a syntax error or the command is unsupported?\n"));
cout(generate_section("My apologies, this feature has yet to be implemented, please look out for updates!\n"));
cout(generate_section("Sorry, some internal error has occured\n"));
* a specific entry in a calendar
* over the course of the development process, i will try to make this as close to the ics file format as possible
//I know this is not what exactly http status code 208 means
//but it is the closest one that I can think of
public calendar_entry_event(String title, String start_time,String end_time){
ui.cout(IO_handler.generate_section("Jawohl, I have marked the following event as completed:\n     " +
ui.cout(IO_handler.generate_section("Jawohl, I have marked the following event as incomplete:\n     " +
* calls corresponding functions based on the input command
* @param input the array of string that contains the command and parameters
* @return status code (adapted from http, with exceptions such as status 0 represents exit)
throw new InvalidParameterException("command string array is not expected to be null, internal error");
* the infinite loop that listens to whatever place that the command is coming from (currently only support console)
* when the command is read, it will be handed over to the dispatch_command function to parse and execute
* after which the dispatch_command function will return a status code (adapted from http, details in respective comments)
* this function will print error msg (if any)
